skills.angular: Self-taught. Used for frontend programming where I was able to appreciate its functionality and modularity. I know Typescript quite well.
skills.csharp: Language learned at school. I am familiar with lambdas, delegates, classes, interface, inheritance, and integration with Entity Framework. I've used it for Console, UWP, WPF, Web e Mobile programming.
skills.flutter: Self-taught. Framework generally used for writing powerful applications on Android, iOS and Web platforms. I appreciated it for its ease of learning, its modularity and for the very active community that develops any kind of extension for every need.
skills.laravel: Self-taught. Used both in its frontend and backend component with the development of Web APIs. I appreciated its simplicity in database operations and at the same time having a strong and secure structure in the authentication phases.
skills.sql: I used it in the following variants: MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server and SQLite. I know the key components of writing tables given an entity-relationship schema as well as data insertions, updates and deletions. I know how to create views and stored procedures.
skills.tensorflow: Self-taught. Library that I was able to use in its version called "Teachable Machine" developed by Google. I am still studying it in order to expand my knowledge.
skills.unity: Game development framework I learned at school. I have used it for some educational projects.

certification.sc9003: SC-900: Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals

education.isii: HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA IN COMPUTER SCIENCE

experience.brainfarm3: First level technical assistance activities at the Province of Piacenza.
experience.latitudo3: Creation of a custom view for Microsoft Power BI suite using the provided APIs and React.
experience.sld3: Activity of creating a showcase website for a sports business. The project was built using WordPress and Avada theme and its graphical plugins. The project was carried out as a secondary activity during university studies.
experience.hs3: Activities of creation of a custom CRM platform for the workflow of various customers. Several languages ​​have been used including C# in its web component (ASP.NET with EXT.NET) and mobile (XAMARIN) and SQL.
experience.bbmolinetto3: Activity of creating a showcase website for a local hotel business. The project was built using WordPress and Elementor with several graphical plugins.
experience.amada3: Creation of a web platform (using C#) to correctly manage spare parts for the company's products.

projects.bdc2: Creation of a mobile application for both iOS and Android that allows the inhabitants of the city of Collecchio to report dangers to people with disabilities. We used the Flutter framework and given the need for automatic risk categorization, machine vision was implemented using a TensorFlow Lite model. The project was launched through a call in collaboration with the University of Parma.
projects.agro2: Project developed using the latest Google framework called Flutter. The project consists in the remaking of an application that allows farmers to check if a plant is sick, what disease it is and what are the possible treatments.
projects.pcar2: Project developed in a school environment. The app was designed for tourists. Through the use of Google Earth we were able to obtain 3D models of the most important monuments of the city. Furthermore, through Unity, Vuforia and a specially created map, we were able to show the user the previously created models and some historical notes of the monuments in question.
projects.ar202: Project developed in a school environment for the call launched by the San Paolo Foundation in Turin during 2017. This project has started because we needed to recover the old website of the project "ARMATAMENTE" that has had been lost. Coded in raw HTML + Bootstrap, JQuery and CSS.
projects.museo3d2: Project developed in the school environment for the "I linguaggi della Contemporaneità" call launched by the San Paolo Foundation in Turin. This project has been defined as "a project of extraordinary originality courtesy of a series of IT innovations at the service of a solid and documented historiographical argument". This project has also had international recognition including the international EUSTORY network. The project consists in the creation of a fully accessible 3D environment in which, through interactions, it is possible to view historical contents relating to the aforementioned call. For the technical part, Unity was used as a framework and C# as a programming language.
